melee: bite +5 (1d8+4 plus grab) and tail slap +0 (1d12+2)
description: This reptile lunges out of the placid water with shocking speed. Its jaw gapes open in a roar, its powerful tail lashing behind.

sections.body: When grappling a foe of its size or smaller, a crocodile can perform a death roll upon making a successful grapple check. As it clings to its foe, it tucks in its legs and rolls rapidly, twisting and wrenching its victim. The crocodile inflicts its bite damage and knocks the creature prone. If successful, the crocodile maintains its grapple.
sections.name: Death Roll

sections.body: A crocodile can hold its breath for a number of rounds equal to 4 times its Constitution score before it risks drowning.
sections.name: Hold Breath

sections.body: Once per minute a crocodile may sprint, increasing its land speed to 40 feet for 1 round.
sections.name: Sprint

sections.body: A crocodile is a primeval reptile that dwells in swamps or along the banks of rivers, a habitat that often puts it in violent contact with unsuspecting prey that come to the water's edge to drink.
The typical crocodile is 14 feet long and weighs 1,400 pounds, but larger species exist. You can use these statistics for similar creatures, such as alligators.

name: Crocodile
